title: ğŸš€ NVIDIA SONIC & EgoScale: Open-Source Whole-Body Humanoid Control Trained on Massive Human Motion Data

sources.author: DrJimFan
sources.text: What can half of GPT-1 do? We trained a 42M transformer called SONIC to control the body of a humanoid robot. It takes a remarkable amount of subconscious processing for us humans to squat, turn, craw

sources.author: DrJimFan
sources.text: We trained a humanoid with 22-DoF dexterous hands to assemble model cars, operate syringes, sort poker cards, fold/roll shirts, all learned primarily from 20,000+ hours of egocentric human video with

sources.author: DrJimFan
sources.text:
This is a huge team work at NVIDIA Robotics. Check out @ruijie_zheng12's deep dive: 

- Website: https://t.co/n3Zp8bh8Ht
- Paper: https://t.co/eXQqSl3GHg

https://t.co/ybup5DhSCM

key_facts: NVIDIA Robotics (led by Dr. Jim Fan) open-sourced SONIC â€” a 42M-parameter transformer that enables zero-shot transfer to real Unitree G1 robot for 50+ diverse motion sequences with 100% success rate
SONIC uses dense human mocap supervision (100M+ frames) instead of hand-engineered rewards, scaling humanoid RL training across 128 GPUs with NVIDIA Isaac Lab (10,000Ã— physics acceleration)
EgoScale framework leverages 20,000+ hours of egocentric human video to pre-train GR00T N1.5, achieving 54% gains on dexterous tasks and enabling single-demo learning for novel skills

Unified action space supports text prompts ('dance like a monkey'), audio-driven motion, VR teleoperation, human video streaming, and integration with VLA models (e.g., GR00T â†’ 95% mobile task success)
All code, model checkpoints, and papers are publicly released; includes cross-hand generalization (22-DoF Sharpa â†’ 7-DoF Unitree G1 tri-finger hands)
analyst_angle: This represents a paradigm shift: humanoid intelligence is no longer bottlenecked by robot hardware or reward engineering, but by scalable human embodiment data â€” turning human video and mocap into the new foundation dataset for robotics, much like web text did for LLMs.
